terms.definition: A distributed digital ledger that records transactions across many computers.
The first and most well-known cryptocurrency, created in 2009.
A blockchain platform that enables smart contracts and decentralized applications.
Self-executing code that automatically performs actions when conditions are met.
Decentralized Finance - financial services built on blockchain without intermediaries.
Non-Fungible Token - a unique digital item stored on blockchain.
Digital tool for storing, sending, and receiving cryptocurrency using private keys.
Process of validating blockchain transactions and creating new coins using computational power.
Locking cryptocurrency to support network operations and earn rewards.
Transaction cost paid to process operations on a blockchain network.
Any cryptocurrency other than Bitcoin.
Holding cryptocurrency long-term despite market volatility.
Decentralized Exchange - trading platform without central authority.
Collection of cryptocurrencies locked in a smart contract to enable trading.
Individual or entity holding large amounts of cryptocurrency that can influence prices.
Market condition characterized by rising prices and optimism.
Market condition characterized by falling prices and pessimism.
Secret cryptographic code that controls access to your cryptocurrency.
12-24 words that can recover your wallet - never share with anyone.
Two-Factor Authentication - extra security layer for your accounts.
Offline hardware device for storing cryptocurrency securely.
Online wallet connected to the internet for easy access.
Total value of all coins in circulation for a cryptocurrency.
All-Time High - the highest price ever reached by a cryptocurrency.
Free distribution of tokens to wallet addresses.
Technical document explaining a cryptocurrency project's goals and technology.
Consensus mechanism requiring computational power to validate transactions.
Consensus mechanism using staked coins instead of computational power.
Secondary framework built on top of a blockchain to improve speed and reduce costs.
Next evolution of the internet built on blockchain with user ownership.
